section.title: SM, NCC ME, and NCC IG network interfaces and IP addresses

li.p: with two types of sites consisting of a Service Manager (SM) and Managed Elements (MEs) or;
with one type of site: NCC Integrated (IG) or;
with two types of sites: NCC IG and Managed Elements (MEs).

section.p: The SM site is used for provisioning and API access. The ME site is used for NCC, Policy, and Notification Service (NS) applications. The IG site is used for provisioning and API access, NCC, Policy, and Notification Service (NS) applications.

The NCC supports internal and external networks. The NCC internal network is a single network that uses IPv4 only. The NCC external network can be a single network or it can consist of multiple networks, and use both IPv4 and IPv6. The NCC supports assigning IP addresses to external interfaces of each VM. However, the NCC supports only static IP address assignment. All the external virtual IP addresses and fixed IP addresses must be statically assigned.
See the NCC Installation and Upgrade Guide for more information about network interfaces.
